required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Continuing Medical Education (CME) Insulin Program
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of CME Program on Self-Reported Confidence and Use of Insulin in Persons With Type 2 Diabetes

collaborator.agency: International Diabetes Center at Park Nicollet

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if a continuing medical education (CME) program can change primary care providers' use of insulin therapy - their confidence in selecting doses and engagement of patients in the decision making as to whether to initiate insulin therapy.

detailed_description.textblock:
We will determine whether attendees' self-reported confidence and use of insulin with persons with type 2 diabetes changes after they attend the CME program. Specifically, we will address the following questions:
Question 1. Clinical guidelines. Is insulin initiated earlier (at a lower A1C)?
Question 2. Decision-making. Does confidence in selecting a starting insulin regimen change? Does confidence in selecting a starting insulin dose change? Does confidence in adjusting insulin change? Does confidence in discussion nutrition guidelines change?
Question 3. Application. Do more patients start using insulin? Who usually selects starting dose? How is starting dose selected? How often is insulin adjusted?
Question 4. Resources. How available are protocols for insulin use? How available is adequate time to monitor insulin therapy? How available is staff to teach insulin injections? How available is staff to help adjust insulin?

primary_outcome.measure: We will determine whether attendees' self-reported confidence and use of insulin with persons with type 2 diabetes changes after they attend the CME program.
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre program survey & 2-4 month post program survey

secondary_outcome.measure: pre-CME training level of patient's A1c when starting insulin therapy compared to post-CME training level of patient's A1c when starting insulin therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre program survey and 2-4 month post program survey

study_pop.textblock: Primary care providers affiliated with the participating healthcare organizations were invited to attend.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- primary care provider attending CME training
Exclusion Criteria:

overall_official.affiliation: International Diabetes Center at Park Nicollet
